71  /**
72   * Export the specified snapshot to a given FileSystem.
73   *
74   * The .snapshot/name folder is copied to the destination cluster
75   * and then all the hfiles/hlogs are copied using a Map-Reduce Job in the .archive/ location.
76   * When everything is done, the second cluster can restore the snapshot.
77   */
78  @InterfaceAudience.Public
79  @InterfaceStability.Evolving
80  public final class ExportSnapshot extends Configured implements Tool {
81    private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(ExportSnapshot.class);
82  
83    private static final String CONF_FILES_USER = "snapshot.export.files.attributes.user";
84    private static final String CONF_FILES_GROUP = "snapshot.export.files.attributes.group";
85    private static final String CONF_FILES_MODE = "snapshot.export.files.attributes.mode";
86    private static final String CONF_CHECKSUM_VERIFY = "snapshot.export.checksum.verify";
87    private static final String CONF_OUTPUT_ROOT = "snapshot.export.output.root";
88    private static final String CONF_INPUT_ROOT = "snapshot.export.input.root";
89    private static final String CONF_STAGING_ROOT = "snapshot.export.staging.root";
90  
91    private static final String INPUT_FOLDER_PREFIX = "export-files.";
92  
93    // Export Map-Reduce Counters, to keep track of the progress
94    public enum Counter { MISSING_FILES, COPY_FAILED, BYTES_EXPECTED, BYTES_COPIED };
95  
96    private static class ExportMapper extends Mapper<Text, NullWritable, NullWritable, NullWritable> {
97      final static int REPORT_SIZE = 1 * 1024 * 1024;
98      final static int BUFFER_SIZE = 64 * 1024;
99  
100     private boolean verifyChecksum;
101     private String filesGroup;
102     private String filesUser;
103     private short filesMode;
104 
105     private FileSystem outputFs;
106     private Path outputArchive;
107     private Path outputRoot;
108 
109     private FileSystem inputFs;
110     private Path inputArchive;
111     private Path inputRoot;
112 
113     @Override
114     public void setup(Context context) {
115       Configuration conf = context.getConfiguration();
116       verifyChecksum = conf.getBoolean(CONF_CHECKSUM_VERIFY, true);
117 
118       filesGroup = conf.get(CONF_FILES_GROUP);
119       filesUser = conf.get(CONF_FILES_USER);
120       filesMode = (short)conf.getInt(CONF_FILES_MODE, 0);
121       outputRoot = new Path(conf.get(CONF_OUTPUT_ROOT));
122       inputRoot = new Path(conf.get(CONF_INPUT_ROOT));
123 
124       inputArchive = new Path(inputRoot, HConstants.HFILE_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY);
125       outputArchive = new Path(outputRoot, HConstants.HFILE_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY);
126 
127       try {
128         inputFs = FileSystem.get(inputRoot.toUri(), conf);
129       } catch (IOException e) {
130         throw new RuntimeException("Could not get the input FileSystem with root=" + inputRoot, e);
131       }
132 
133       try {
134         outputFs = FileSystem.get(outputRoot.toUri(), conf);
135       } catch (IOException e) {
136         throw new RuntimeException("Could not get the output FileSystem with root="+ outputRoot, e);
137       }
138     }
139 
140     @Override
141     public void map(Text key, NullWritable value, Context context)
142         throws InterruptedException, IOException {
143       Path inputPath = new Path(key.toString());
144       Path outputPath = getOutputPath(inputPath);
145 
146       LOG.info("copy file input=" + inputPath + " output=" + outputPath);
147       if (copyFile(context, inputPath, outputPath)) {
148         LOG.info("copy completed for input=" + inputPath + " output=" + outputPath);
149       }
150     }
151 
152     /**
153      * Returns the location where the inputPath will be copied.
154      *  - hfiles are encoded as hfile links hfile-region-table
155      *  - logs are encoded as serverName/logName
156      */
157     private Path getOutputPath(final Path inputPath) throws IOException {
158       Path path;
159       if (HFileLink.isHFileLink(inputPath) || StoreFile.isReference(inputPath)) {
160         String family = inputPath.getParent().getName();
161         String table = HFileLink.getReferencedTableName(inputPath.getName());
162         String region = HFileLink.getReferencedRegionName(inputPath.getName());
163         String hfile = HFileLink.getReferencedHFileName(inputPath.getName());
164         path = new Path(table, new Path(region, new Path(family, hfile)));
165       } else if (isHLogLinkPath(inputPath)) {
166         String logName = inputPath.getName();
167         path = new Path(new Path(outputRoot, HConstants.HREGION_OLDLOGDIR_NAME), logName);
168       } else {
169         path = inputPath;
170       }
171       return new Path(outputArchive, path);
172     }
173 
174     private boolean copyFile(final Context context, final Path inputPath, final Path outputPath)
175         throws IOException {
176       FSDataInputStream in = openSourceFile(inputPath);
177       if (in == null) {
178         context.getCounter(Counter.MISSING_FILES).increment(1);
179         return false;
180       }
181 
182       try {
183         // Verify if the input file exists
184         FileStatus inputStat = getFileStatus(inputFs, inputPath);
185         if (inputStat == null) return false;
186 
187         // Verify if the output file exists and is the same that we want to copy
188         if (outputFs.exists(outputPath)) {
189           FileStatus outputStat = outputFs.getFileStatus(outputPath);
190           if (sameFile(inputStat, outputStat)) {
191             LOG.info("Skip copy " + inputPath + " to " + outputPath + ", same file.");
192             return true;
193           }
194         }
195 
196         context.getCounter(Counter.BYTES_EXPECTED).increment(inputStat.getLen());
197 
198         // Ensure that the output folder is there and copy the file
199         outputFs.mkdirs(outputPath.getParent());
200         FSDataOutputStream out = outputFs.create(outputPath, true);
201         try {
202           if (!copyData(context, inputPath, in, outputPath, out, inputStat.getLen()))
203             return false;
204         } finally {
205           out.close();
206         }
207 
208         // Preserve attributes
209         return preserveAttributes(outputPath, inputStat);
210       } finally {
211         in.close();
212       }
213     }
214 
215     /**
216      * Preserve the files attribute selected by the user copying them from the source file
217      */
218     private boolean preserveAttributes(final Path path, final FileStatus refStat) {
219       FileStatus stat;
220       try {
221         stat = outputFs.getFileStatus(path);
222       } catch (IOException e) {
223         LOG.warn("Unable to get the status for file=" + path);
224         return false;
225       }
226 
227       try {
228         if (filesMode > 0 && stat.getPermission().toShort() != filesMode) {
229           outputFs.setPermission(path, new FsPermission(filesMode));
230         } else if (!stat.getPermission().equals(refStat.getPermission())) {
231           outputFs.setPermission(path, refStat.getPermission());
232         }
233       } catch (IOException e) {
234         LOG.error("Unable to set the permission for file=" + path, e);
235         return false;
236       }
237 
238       try {
239         String user = (filesUser != null) ? filesUser : refStat.getOwner();
240         String group = (filesGroup != null) ? filesGroup : refStat.getGroup();
241         if (!(user.equals(stat.getOwner()) && group.equals(stat.getGroup()))) {
242           outputFs.setOwner(path, user, group);
243         }
244       } catch (IOException e) {
245         LOG.error("Unable to set the owner/group for file=" + path, e);
246         return false;
247       }
248 
249       return true;
250     }
251 
252     private boolean copyData(final Context context,
253         final Path inputPath, final FSDataInputStream in,
254         final Path outputPath, final FSDataOutputStream out,
255         final long inputFileSize) {
256       final String statusMessage = "copied %s/" + StringUtils.humanReadableInt(inputFileSize) +
257                                    " (%.3f%%) from " + inputPath + " to " + outputPath;
258 
259       try {
260         byte[] buffer = new byte[BUFFER_SIZE];
261         long totalBytesWritten = 0;
262         int reportBytes = 0;
263         int bytesRead;
264 
265         while ((bytesRead = in.read(buffer)) > 0) {
266           out.write(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
267           totalBytesWritten += bytesRead;
268           reportBytes += bytesRead;
269 
270           if (reportBytes >= REPORT_SIZE) {
271             context.getCounter(Counter.BYTES_COPIED).increment(reportBytes);
272             context.setStatus(String.format(statusMessage,
273                               StringUtils.humanReadableInt(totalBytesWritten),
274                               reportBytes/(float)inputFileSize));
275             reportBytes = 0;
276           }
277         }
278 
279         context.getCounter(Counter.BYTES_COPIED).increment(reportBytes);
280         context.setStatus(String.format(statusMessage,
281                           StringUtils.humanReadableInt(totalBytesWritten),
282                           reportBytes/(float)inputFileSize));
283 
284         // Verify that the written size match
285         if (totalBytesWritten != inputFileSize) {
286           LOG.error("number of bytes copied not matching copied=" + totalBytesWritten +
287                     " expected=" + inputFileSize + " for file=" + inputPath);
288           context.getCounter(Counter.COPY_FAILED).increment(1);
289           return false;
290         }
291 
292         return true;
293       } catch (IOException e) {
294         LOG.error("Error copying " + inputPath + " to " + outputPath, e);
295         context.getCounter(Counter.COPY_FAILED).increment(1);
296         return false;
297       }
298     }
299 
300     private FSDataInputStream openSourceFile(final Path path) {
301       try {
302         if (HFileLink.isHFileLink(path) || StoreFile.isReference(path)) {
303           return new HFileLink(inputRoot, inputArchive, path).open(inputFs);
304         } else if (isHLogLinkPath(path)) {
305           String serverName = path.getParent().getName();
306           String logName = path.getName();
307           return new HLogLink(inputRoot, serverName, logName).open(inputFs);
308         }
309         return inputFs.open(path);
310       } catch (IOException e) {
311         LOG.error("Unable to open source file=" + path, e);
312         return null;
313       }
314     }
315 
316     private FileStatus getFileStatus(final FileSystem fs, final Path path) {
317       try {
318         if (HFileLink.isHFileLink(path) || StoreFile.isReference(path)) {
319           HFileLink link = new HFileLink(inputRoot, inputArchive, path);
320           return link.getFileStatus(fs);
321         } else if (isHLogLinkPath(path)) {
322           String serverName = path.getParent().getName();
323           String logName = path.getName();
324           return new HLogLink(inputRoot, serverName, logName).getFileStatus(fs);
325         }
326         return fs.getFileStatus(path);
327       } catch (IOException e) {
328         LOG.warn("Unable to get the status for file=" + path);
329         return null;
330       }
331     }
332 
333     private FileChecksum getFileChecksum(final FileSystem fs, final Path path) {
334       try {
335         return fs.getFileChecksum(path);
336       } catch (IOException e) {
337         LOG.warn("Unable to get checksum for file=" + path, e);
338         return null;
339       }
340     }
341 
342     /**
343      * Check if the two files are equal by looking at the file length,
344      * and at the checksum (if user has specified the verifyChecksum flag).
345      */
346     private boolean sameFile(final FileStatus inputStat, final FileStatus outputStat) {
347       // Not matching length
348       if (inputStat.getLen() != outputStat.getLen()) return false;
349 
350       // Mark files as equals, since user asked for no checksum verification
351       if (!verifyChecksum) return true;
352 
353       // If checksums are not available, files are not the same.
354       FileChecksum inChecksum = getFileChecksum(inputFs, inputStat.getPath());
355       if (inChecksum == null) return false;
356 
357       FileChecksum outChecksum = getFileChecksum(outputFs, outputStat.getPath());
358       if (outChecksum == null) return false;
359 
360       return inChecksum.equals(outChecksum);
361     }
362 
363     /**
364      * HLog files are encoded as serverName/logName
365      * and since all the other files should be in /hbase/table/..path..
366      * we can rely on the depth, for now.
367      */
368     private static boolean isHLogLinkPath(final Path path) {
369       return path.depth() == 2;
370     }
371   }

373   /**
374    * Extract the list of files (HFiles/HLogs) to copy using Map-Reduce.
375    * @return list of files referenced by the snapshot (pair of path and size)
376    */
377   private List<Pair<Path, Long>> getSnapshotFiles(final FileSystem fs, final Path snapshotDir)
378       throws IOException {
379     SnapshotDescription snapshotDesc = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.readSnapshotInfo(fs, snapshotDir);
380 
381     final List<Pair<Path, Long>> files = new ArrayList<Pair<Path, Long>>();
382     final String table = snapshotDesc.getTable();
383     final Configuration conf = getConf();
384 
385     // Get snapshot files
386     SnapshotReferenceUtil.visitReferencedFiles(fs, snapshotDir,
387       new SnapshotReferenceUtil.FileVisitor() {
388         public void storeFile (final String region, final String family, final String hfile)
389             throws IOException {
390           Path path = HFileLink.createPath(table, region, family, hfile);
391           long size = new HFileLink(conf, path).getFileStatus(fs).getLen();
392           files.add(new Pair<Path, Long>(path, size));
393         }
394 
395         public void recoveredEdits (final String region, final String logfile)
396             throws IOException {
397           // copied with the snapshot referenecs
398         }
399 
400         public void logFile (final String server, final String logfile)
401             throws IOException {
402           long size = new HLogLink(conf, server, logfile).getFileStatus(fs).getLen();
403           files.add(new Pair<Path, Long>(new Path(server, logfile), size));
404         }
405     });
406 
407     return files;
408   }
409 
410   /**
411    * Given a list of file paths and sizes, create around ngroups in as balanced a way as possible.
412    * The groups created will have similar amounts of bytes.
413    * <p>
414    * The algorithm used is pretty straightforward; the file list is sorted by size,
415    * and then each group fetch the bigger file available, iterating through groups
416    * alternating the direction.
417    */
418   static List<List<Path>> getBalancedSplits(final List<Pair<Path, Long>> files, int ngroups) {
419     // Sort files by size, from small to big
420     Collections.sort(files, new Comparator<Pair<Path, Long>>() {
421       public int compare(Pair<Path, Long> a, Pair<Path, Long> b) {
422         long r = a.getSecond() - b.getSecond();
423         return (r < 0) ? -1 : ((r > 0) ? 1 : 0);
424       }
425     });
426 
427     // create balanced groups
428     List<List<Path>> fileGroups = new LinkedList<List<Path>>();
429     long[] sizeGroups = new long[ngroups];
430     int hi = files.size() - 1;
431     int lo = 0;
432 
433     List<Path> group;
434     int dir = 1;
435     int g = 0;
436 
437     while (hi >= lo) {
438       if (g == fileGroups.size()) {
439         group = new LinkedList<Path>();
440         fileGroups.add(group);
441       } else {
442         group = fileGroups.get(g);
443       }
444 
445       Pair<Path, Long> fileInfo = files.get(hi--);
446 
447       // add the hi one
448       sizeGroups[g] += fileInfo.getSecond();
449       group.add(fileInfo.getFirst());
450 
451       // change direction when at the end or the beginning
452       g += dir;
453       if (g == ngroups) {
454         dir = -1;
455         g = ngroups - 1;
456       } else if (g < 0) {
457         dir = 1;
458         g = 0;
459       }
460     }
461 
462     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
463       for (int i = 0; i < sizeGroups.length; ++i) {
464         LOG.debug("export split=" + i + " size=" + StringUtils.humanReadableInt(sizeGroups[i]));
465       }
466     }
467 
468     return fileGroups;
469   }
470 
471   private static Path getInputFolderPath(final FileSystem fs, final Configuration conf)
472       throws IOException, InterruptedException {
473     String stagingName = "exportSnapshot-" + EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
474     Path stagingDir = new Path(conf.get(CONF_STAGING_ROOT, fs.getWorkingDirectory().toString())
475         , stagingName);
476     fs.mkdirs(stagingDir);
477     return new Path(stagingDir, INPUT_FOLDER_PREFIX +
478       String.valueOf(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis()));
479   }
480 
481   /**
482    * Create the input files, with the path to copy, for the MR job.
483    * Each input files contains n files, and each input file has a similar amount data to copy.
484    * The number of input files created are based on the number of mappers provided as argument
485    * and the number of the files to copy.
486    */
487   private static Path[] createInputFiles(final Configuration conf,
488       final List<Pair<Path, Long>> snapshotFiles, int mappers)
489       throws IOException, InterruptedException {
490     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(conf);
491     Path inputFolderPath = getInputFolderPath(fs, conf);
492     LOG.debug("Input folder location: " + inputFolderPath);
493 
494     List<List<Path>> splits = getBalancedSplits(snapshotFiles, mappers);
495     Path[] inputFiles = new Path[splits.size()];
496 
497     Text key = new Text();
498     for (int i = 0; i < inputFiles.length; i++) {
499       List<Path> files = splits.get(i);
500       inputFiles[i] = new Path(inputFolderPath, String.format("export-%d.seq", i));
501       SequenceFile.Writer writer = SequenceFile.createWriter(fs, conf, inputFiles[i],
502         Text.class, NullWritable.class);
503       LOG.debug("Input split: " + i);
504       try {
505         for (Path file: files) {
506           LOG.debug(file.toString());
507           key.set(file.toString());
508           writer.append(key, NullWritable.get());
509         }
510       } finally {
511         writer.close();
512       }
513     }
514 
515     return inputFiles;
516   }
517 
518   /**
519    * Run Map-Reduce Job to perform the files copy.
520    */
521   private boolean runCopyJob(final Path inputRoot, final Path outputRoot,
522       final List<Pair<Path, Long>> snapshotFiles, final boolean verifyChecksum,
523       final String filesUser, final String filesGroup, final int filesMode,
524       final int mappers) throws IOException, InterruptedException, ClassNotFoundException {
525     Configuration conf = getConf();
526     if (filesGroup != null) conf.set(CONF_FILES_GROUP, filesGroup);
527     if (filesUser != null) conf.set(CONF_FILES_USER, filesUser);
528     conf.setInt(CONF_FILES_MODE, filesMode);
529     conf.setBoolean(CONF_CHECKSUM_VERIFY, verifyChecksum);
530     conf.set(CONF_OUTPUT_ROOT, outputRoot.toString());
531     conf.set(CONF_INPUT_ROOT, inputRoot.toString());
532     conf.setInt("mapreduce.job.maps", mappers);
533 
534     // job.setMapSpeculativeExecution(false)
535     conf.setBoolean("mapreduce.map.speculative", false);
536     conf.setBoolean("mapreduce.reduce.speculative", false);
537     conf.setBoolean("mapred.map.tasks.speculative.execution", false);
538     conf.setBoolean("mapred.reduce.tasks.speculative.execution", false);
539 
540     Job job = new Job(conf);
541     job.setJobName("ExportSnapshot");
542     job.setJarByClass(ExportSnapshot.class);
543     TableMapReduceUtil.addDependencyJars(job);
544     job.setMapperClass(ExportMapper.class);
545     job.setInputFormatClass(SequenceFileInputFormat.class);
546     job.setOutputFormatClass(NullOutputFormat.class);
547     job.setNumReduceTasks(0);
548     for (Path path: createInputFiles(conf, snapshotFiles, mappers)) {
549       LOG.debug("Add Input Path=" + path);
550       SequenceFileInputFormat.addInputPath(job, path);
551     }
552 
553     return job.waitForCompletion(true);
554   }
555 
556   /**
557    * Execute the export snapshot by copying the snapshot metadata, hfiles and hlogs.
558    * @return 0 on success, and != 0 upon failure.
559    */
560   @Override
561   public int run(String[] args) throws Exception {
562     boolean verifyChecksum = true;
563     String snapshotName = null;
564     String filesGroup = null;
565     String filesUser = null;
566     Path outputRoot = null;
567     int filesMode = 0;
568     int mappers = getConf().getInt("mapreduce.job.maps", 1);
569 
570     // Process command line args
571     for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
572       String cmd = args[i];
573       try {
574         if (cmd.equals("-snapshot")) {
575           snapshotName = args[++i];
576         } else if (cmd.equals("-copy-to")) {
577           outputRoot = new Path(args[++i]);
578         } else if (cmd.equals("-no-checksum-verify")) {
579           verifyChecksum = false;
580         } else if (cmd.equals("-mappers")) {
581           mappers = Integer.parseInt(args[++i]);
582         } else if (cmd.equals("-chuser")) {
583           filesUser = args[++i];
584         } else if (cmd.equals("-chgroup")) {
585           filesGroup = args[++i];
586         } else if (cmd.equals("-chmod")) {
587           filesMode = Integer.parseInt(args[++i], 8);
588         } else if (cmd.equals("-h") || cmd.equals("--help")) {
589           printUsageAndExit();
590         } else {
591           System.err.println("UNEXPECTED: " + cmd);
592           printUsageAndExit();
593         }
594       } catch (Exception e) {
595         printUsageAndExit();
596       }
597     }
598 
599     // Check user options
600     if (snapshotName == null) {
601       System.err.println("Snapshot name not provided.");
602       printUsageAndExit();
603     }
604 
605     if (outputRoot == null) {
606       System.err.println("Destination file-system not provided.");
607       printUsageAndExit();
608     }
609 
610     Configuration conf = getConf();
611     Path inputRoot = FSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
612     FileSystem inputFs = FileSystem.get(conf);
613     FileSystem outputFs = FileSystem.get(outputRoot.toUri(), conf);
614 
615     Path snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getCompletedSnapshotDir(snapshotName, inputRoot);
616     Path snapshotTmpDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getWorkingSnapshotDir(snapshotName, outputRoot);
617     Path outputSnapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getCompletedSnapshotDir(snapshotName, outputRoot);
618 
619     // Check if the snapshot already exists
620     if (outputFs.exists(outputSnapshotDir)) {
621       System.err.println("The snapshot '" + snapshotName +
622         "' already exists in the destination: " + outputSnapshotDir);
623       return 1;
624     }
625 
626     // Check if the snapshot already in-progress
627     if (outputFs.exists(snapshotTmpDir)) {
628       System.err.println("A snapshot with the same name '" + snapshotName + "' may be in-progress");
629       System.err.println("Please check " + snapshotTmpDir + ". If the snapshot has completed, ");
630       System.err.println("consider removing " + snapshotTmpDir + " before retrying export");
631       return 1;
632     }
633 
634     // Step 0 - Extract snapshot files to copy
635     final List<Pair<Path, Long>> files = getSnapshotFiles(inputFs, snapshotDir);
636 
637     // Step 1 - Copy fs1:/.snapshot/<snapshot> to  fs2:/.snapshot/.tmp/<snapshot>
638     // The snapshot references must be copied before the hfiles otherwise the cleaner
639     // will remove them because they are unreferenced.
640     try {
641       FileUtil.copy(inputFs, snapshotDir, outputFs, snapshotTmpDir, false, false, conf);
642     } catch (IOException e) {
643       System.err.println("Failed to copy the snapshot directory: from=" + snapshotDir +
644         " to=" + snapshotTmpDir);
645       e.printStackTrace(System.err);
646       return 1;
647     }
648 
649     // Step 2 - Start MR Job to copy files
650     // The snapshot references must be copied before the files otherwise the files gets removed
651     // by the HFileArchiver, since they have no references.
652     try {
653       if (files.size() == 0) {
654         LOG.warn("There are 0 store file to be copied. There may be no data in the table.");
655       } else {
656         if (!runCopyJob(inputRoot, outputRoot, files, verifyChecksum,
657             filesUser, filesGroup, filesMode, mappers)) {
658           throw new ExportSnapshotException("Snapshot export failed!");
659         }
660       }
661 
662       // Step 3 - Rename fs2:/.snapshot/.tmp/<snapshot> fs2:/.snapshot/<snapshot>
663       if (!outputFs.rename(snapshotTmpDir, outputSnapshotDir)) {
664         System.err.println("Snapshot export failed!");
665         System.err.println("Unable to rename snapshot directory from=" +
666                            snapshotTmpDir + " to=" + outputSnapshotDir);
667         return 1;
668       }
669 
670       return 0;
671     } catch (Exception e) {
672       System.err.println("Snapshot export failed!");
673       e.printStackTrace(System.err);
674       outputFs.delete(outputSnapshotDir, true);
675       return 1;
676     }
677   }

680   private void printUsageAndExit() {
681     System.err.printf("Usage: bin/hbase %s [options]%n", getClass().getName());
682     System.err.println(" where [options] are:");
683     System.err.println("  -h|-help                Show this help and exit.");
684     System.err.println("  -snapshot NAME          Snapshot to restore.");
685     System.err.println("  -copy-to NAME           Remote destination hdfs://");
686     System.err.println("  -no-checksum-verify     Do not verify checksum.");
687     System.err.println("  -chuser USERNAME        Change the owner of the files to the specified one.");
688     System.err.println("  -chgroup GROUP          Change the group of the files to the specified one.");
689     System.err.println("  -chmod MODE             Change the permission of the files to the specified one.");
690     System.err.println("  -mappers                Number of mappers to use during the copy (mapreduce.job.maps).");
691     System.err.println();
692     System.err.println("Examples:");
693     System.err.println("  hbase " + getClass() + " \\");
694     System.err.println("    -snapshot MySnapshot -copy-to hdfs:///srv2:8082/hbase \\");
695     System.err.println("    -chuser MyUser -chgroup MyGroup -chmod 700 -mappers 16");
696     System.exit(1);
697   }
